Description: Rim and handle zone sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup with part of handle root on left; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: lip and handle root glazed; in handle zone black -igure decoration consisting of upper part of man bending over, to right; probably part of an erotic scene.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 396, no. B580)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0478) (Phase 1)
